result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Initial Appearance

3:20 PM Defendant Stephen James McDonnell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Stephen James McDonnell.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders $2500 cash bond with conditions: Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and Level IV Pretrial Services
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case. Absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with alcohol bracelet.   Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
